response.overview: In a city of 20 million, where hundreds of lives are lost each day, graveyards are not just spaces for burial. They offer a moment of reflection on the finite and fleeting nature of human life. In a society shaped by fear and the relentless demands of urban life, people often shy away from confronting their own mortality. Through a visual exploration of the rituals performed by visitors, this film delves into the emotional and social meanings graveyards hold. It reflects on the inevitability of death, and the role these spaces play in helping people come to terms with loss.
response.tagline: A gravedigger, a visitor, and a flower vendor navigate Karachi’s cemeteries, sharing their relationships with mortality. Through their stories of loss and resilience, this film offers a moment of reflection on the transience of life.
response.title: Do Gaz Zameen (Two Yards of Land)
